derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: from French glande, alteration of Old French glandre, from Latin glandulae 'throat glands'
early 19th cent.: probably a variant of Scots glam 'a vice or clamp'; related to clamp

entry.def: A gland is an organ in the body which produces chemical substances for the body to use or get rid of.

example.ex: ...the hormones secreted by our endocrine glands.

means.word_mean: 1. any of various organs that synthesize substances needed by the body and release it through ducts or directly into the bloodstream
